intro: Euodia labordei, commonly known as the laborde's euodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the island of Socotra, which is located in the Arabian Sea. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and distinctive, leathery leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, Euodia labordei is considered a rare and endemic species.
